p: The grass family is one of the most prominent groups that has great economic importance to humans (food crops, shelter, fodder, industry, decontamination, etc.). There are more than 10000 species grouped into around 800 genera. Corn, rice, wheat, and bamboo are part of this family, which is distributed worldwide and represents approximately 20% of the Earthâ€™s vegetative cover. Grasses are usually annual or perennial herbs. Even though they are not truly woody, like dicot trees or shrubs, some canes have similar strength to steel.
